title: How to Make Elderberry Vinegar

steps.headline: Place the berries into a deep, non-metallic bowl.
steps.description: Or place them into a crock.

steps.headline: Crush the berries with a wooden spoon.
steps.description: Pour the vinegar over the crushed berries.

steps.headline: Cover the crushed berries with a lid.
steps.description: Leave for a week or more; stir daily.

steps.headline: Strain the steeped liquid.
steps.description: Measure the vinegar and pour it into a saucepan.

steps.headline: Measure the sugar.
steps.description: As noted in the ingredients, measure 350g sugar to 600ml of liquid.

steps.headline: Heat gently (low heat).
steps.description: Stir regularly until the sugar dissolves.

steps.headline: Boil.
steps.description: Once the sugar dissolves, bring to the boil. Boil rapidly for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Pour the vinegar into sterilized bottles.
steps.description: Seal with a lid or cork.

steps.headline: Use.
steps.description: This vinegar can be used in place of balsamic vinegar. It is also a delicious dessert vinegar, suitable for pouring over dark, heavy puddings (such as fruit pudding).
